title: Do student loans affect my taxes?
main_content: At the end of each year, your servicer will send you Form 1098-E by mail or electronically. This form details how much interest you have paid on your student loan during the year. You can deduct up to $2,500 in annual interest on your tax return, subject to income limitations and other restrictions. Consult the IRS website  or a tax professional for details.
key_message: There may be a tax deduction available for the interest you paid on qualifying student loans. Check with your loan servicer to see if your loan meets the qualifications.
